intro: Adenocalymma arthropetiolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and dry forest habitats, often in well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
